main.enactingFormula: (Made by the Secretary for Transport and Housing under section 6A of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374))

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Regulation comes into operation on 1 November 2021.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions come into operation on a day to be appointed by the Commissioner for Transport by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 5 and 6 (in so far as they relate to section 4).

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—
subsection.def: movement permit (車輛行駛許可證) has the meaning given by regulation 2(1) of the Registration and Licensing Regulations;
prescribed fee (訂明費用), in relation to a matter specified in Schedule 3, means the fee specified in that Schedule for the matter;
Tag Authority (繳費貼當局) means the Commissioner or a tag agent;
toll tag (繳費貼) has the meaning given by section 6A(5) of the Ordinance;
trade licence (試車牌照) has the meaning given by regulation 2(1) of the Registration and Licensing Regulations;

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a toll tag is used in connection with a motor vehicle if the toll tag is affixed to or displayed on the motor vehicle, whether or not any use by the motor vehicle of any specified Government infrastructure has been, is or is about to be detected.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Before commencement of section 4, certain requirements apply if toll tag is used

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 5 and 6, if a toll tag is used in connection with a motor vehicle, a person who is the responsible person or driver of the motor vehicle must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (2) is complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (3) is complied with.

subsection.leadIn: The toll tag—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be an appropriate toll tag;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be free from any interference that prevents the toll tag from being read properly or causes the toll tag to fail to operate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be affixed to the motor vehicle in the way specified in Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must be the only toll tag used in connection with the motor vehicle.

subsection.content: The toll tag must be in good working order.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in any other case—to a fine at level 1.

subsection.content: It is a defence to a charge alleging a contravention of subsection (1)(a) for the person charged to prove that the motor vehicle to which the charge relates was, at the time of the contravention, parked on a private road.
This section expires on the commencement of section 4.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Toll tag required for certain motor vehicle and other requirements applicable generally

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 5 and 6—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is the responsible person or driver of a tag-required vehicle must ensure that—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is the responsible person or driver of a tag-in-use vehicle must ensure that—

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a tag-required vehicle is a motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is licensed under regulation 21 of the Registration and Licensing Regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which an international circulation permit is issued under regulation 31 of those Regulations.

subsection.leadIn: A toll tag must at all times be used in connection with a tag-required vehicle and the toll tag—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be an appropriate toll tag;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be free from any interference that prevents the toll tag from being read properly or causes the toll tag to fail to operate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be affixed to the motor vehicle in the way specified in Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must be the only toll tag used in connection with the motor vehicle.

subsection.content: A toll tag used in connection with a tag-required vehicle must be in good working order.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a motor vehicle is a tag-in-use vehicle if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a toll tag is used in connection with the motor vehicle; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the motor vehicle is not a tag-required vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A toll tag used in connection with a tag-in-use vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be an appropriate toll tag;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be free from any interference that prevents the toll tag from being read properly or causes the toll tag to fail to operate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be affixed to the motor vehicle in the way specified in Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must be the only toll tag used in connection with the motor vehicle.

subsection.content: A toll tag used in connection with a tag-in-use vehicle must be in good working order.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1)(a)(i) or (b)(i) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a contravention in relation to a failure to comply with subsection (3)(a) or (6)(a)—to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 3 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—to a fine at level 1.

subsection.content: It is a defence to a charge alleging a contravention of subsection (1)(a)(i) or (b)(i) for the person charged to prove that the motor vehicle to which the charge relates was, at the time of the contravention, parked on a private road.

subsection.leadIn: For a motor vehicle referred to in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person does not contravene section 3 or 4 in relation to the motor vehicle only because section 3(2)(b) or (c) or 4(3)(b) or (c) or (6)(b) or (c) is not complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person does not contravene section 4 in relation to the motor vehicle only because no toll tag is used in connection with the motor vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: The motor vehicle is one that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is being towed by another motor vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is used under a trade licence that is displayed on the motor vehicle.

tr.td: This section came into operation on 1 November 2021 (except in so far as it relates to section 4)—see L.N. 216 of 2021.

subsection.content: If the Commissioner considers it in the public interest to do so, the Commissioner may grant an exemption, from a requirement under section 3 or 4, in respect of a motor vehicle.
The Commissioner may not grant an exemption from a requirement that a toll tag used in connection with a motor vehicle must be an appropriate toll tag.
An exemption under subsection (1) is to be granted by written notice and is subject to any conditions that may be specified in the notice.
The Commissioner may exercise any power under subsection (1) generally or in any case or class of cases.

tr.td: This section came into operation on 1 November 2021 (except in so far as it relates to section 4)—see L.N. 216 of 2021.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Appointment of tag agent
section.content: The Commissioner may appoint a person as an agent of the Commissioner for the purposes of this Regulation.

subsection.content: A Tag Authority may, on application and on payment of the prescribed fee, issue a toll tag for use in connection with a particular motor vehicle, registered or used under an international circulation permit, (vehicle tag) to the responsible person of the motor vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (1) may be made, in respect of a motor vehicle, by a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the motor vehicle is registered and the person is the registered owner of the motor vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: the motor vehicle is used under an international circulation permit and the person is the holder of the permit; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the person has made, in respect of the motor vehicle, an application for an international circulation permit under regulation 31 of the Registration and Licensing Regulations.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (1) must be made in a form specified under section 11 and the form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be completed in accordance with the directions and instructions specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must, on completion, be sent to a Tag Authority in a way specified in the form and be accompanied by the information and documents specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner considers it in the public interest to do so, the Commissioner may, on his or her own initiative and whether through a tag agent or otherwise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue vehicle tags in respect of motor vehicles generally or in respect of any class of motor vehicles; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a vehicle tag in respect of a motor vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A vehicle tag, issued for use in connection with a motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must store data required for the operation of the vehicle tag, including data corresponding to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the motor vehicle is registered—the vehicle identification number of the motor vehicle;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the motor vehicle is used under an international circulation permit—the reference number assigned by the Commissioner to the motor vehicle; and
the serial number of the vehicle tag assigned by the manufacturer of the vehicle tag; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may store any other data as the Commissioner thinks fit for the operation of the vehicle tag.

subsection.content: A vehicle tag is issued subject to the conditions of issue.
On the issue of a vehicle tag for use in connection with a motor vehicle, each vehicle tag formerly issued for use in connection with the motor vehicle (if any) ceases to be valid.
A Tag Authority may, on payment of the prescribed fee, issue a toll tag for use in connection with any motor vehicle falling within a particular class (class tag).

subsection.leadIn: A class tag, issued for use in connection with any motor vehicle falling within a particular class—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must store data required for the operation of the class tag, including data corresponding to—

subparagraph.content: the reference number assigned by the Commissioner to the class tag;
the class identification number assigned by the Commissioner to the class; and
the serial number of the class tag assigned by the manufacturer of the class tag; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may store any other data as the Commissioner thinks fit for the operation of the class tag.

subsection.content: A class tag is issued subject to the conditions of issue.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions of issue for a vehicle tag or a class tag may, from time to time, be determined by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a tag agent with the approval of the Commissioner.

subsection.content: A determination under subsection (1) may be made generally or in any case or class of cases.

The responsible person of a motor vehicle, in connection with which a vehicle tag or a class tag is used, is bound by the conditions of issue for the vehicle tag or the class tag (as the case requires).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions of issue determined under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made readily accessible to the general public in a way that a Tag Authority thinks fit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the conditions of issue are determined for a vehicle tag issued for use in connection with a particular motor vehicle—

subparagraph.content: must be notified by a Tag Authority to the responsible person of the motor vehicle, as soon as practicable after the determination; and
must be notified by a Tag Authority to a person who becomes the responsible person of the motor vehicle, as soon as practicable after the person becomes the responsible person.

subsection.leadIn: The form of an application required for the purposes of section 8 may be specified by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a tag agent with the approval of the Commissioner.

subsection.content: More than one form of the application may be specified under subsection (1), whether as alternatives or to provide for different circumstances.

If the Commissioner considers it in the public interest to do so, the Commissioner may waive, exempt, reduce or refund, in whole or in part, the prescribed fee payable or paid for the issue of a vehicle tag or a class tag under section 8 or 9.
The Commissioner may exercise any power under subsection (1) generally or in any case or class of cases.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 2
section.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2.

section.content: Public light buses and private light buses

section.content: Light goods vehicles, and special purpose vehicles of a permitted gross vehicle weight not exceeding 5.5 tonnes

section.name: s6

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Way in which Toll Tag must be Affixed

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 3(2)(c) and 4(3)(c) and (6)(c), a toll tag used in connection with a motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be affixed to the motor vehicle in the way specified in section 2, 3 or 4 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be oriented horizontally.

section.name: s2
section.content: Unless section 3 or 4 of this Schedule applies, the toll tag must be directly affixed, to the inside surface of the front windscreen of a motor vehicle, by means of the adhesive of the toll tag.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: If a motor vehicle has a front windscreen and the whole, or any part, of the front windscreen is shielded by a metallic substance, the toll tag must be affixed to the motor vehicle in the following way—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the front windscreen has a part that is not shielded by a metallic substance (unshielded part)—the toll tag must be directly affixed, to the inside surface of the unshielded part of the front windscreen, by means of the adhesive of the toll tag;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the whole of the front windscreen is shielded by a metallic substance—

subparagraph.content: for a motor vehicle that has a reflecting mirror—the toll tag must be directly affixed, to a non-metallic surface of the back side of the reflecting mirror, by means of the adhesive of the toll tag; or

subparagraph.leadIn: for a motor vehicle that does not have a reflecting mirror—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the toll tag must be directly affixed to a non-metallic holder, by means of the adhesive of the toll tag; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the non-metallic holder, affixed with the toll tag, must be directly mounted onto the motor vehicle at a location such that the toll tag affixed is not obscured by anything in front of the motor vehicle.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: If a motor vehicle does not have a front windscreen, the toll tag must be affixed to the motor vehicle in the following way—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: for a motor vehicle that does not have a reflecting mirror—

subparagraph.content: the toll tag must be directly affixed to a non-metallic holder, by means of the adhesive of the toll tag; and

the non-metallic holder, affixed with the toll tag, must be directly mounted onto the motor vehicle at a location such that the toll tag affixed is not obscured by anything in front of the motor vehicle.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: In this Schedule, a part of a front windscreen is shielded by a metallic substance if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: as a result, a toll tag if affixed to that part of the front windscreen will be prevented from being read properly or will be caused to fail to operate,

section.continued: and a reference to the whole of a front windscreen being shielded by a metallic substance is to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s6
section.def: reflecting mirror (反射鏡) means a non-metallic reflecting mirror fitted to a motor vehicle externally and includes a wing or side mirror.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Prescribed Fees for Issue of Toll Tags

td.p: Issue of a vehicle tag in respect of a motor vehicle under section 8—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is the first vehicle tag issued in respect of the motor vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is the second or any subsequent vehicle tag issued in respect of the motor vehicle

td.p: Issue of a class tag under section 9
